metadata.description: Minimum wage is about the day that I understood that he bare minimum of absolutely anything is simply not going to cut it anymore (wage, love, time, loyalty, energy, you name it). This record was born in my writing sanctuary, the castle in Bordeaux, France, in a writing camp with 3 incredible producers. It is an anthem of all of our early twenties, a time stamp of my many day jobs - selling printer ink to the US army, assistant to an interior designer, party planning, waiting tables, singing at steak houses to empty rooms, you name it. This song is an ode of gratitude and respect to those choices in the pursuit of the dream - running to sessions and rehearsals after an 8-hour minimum wage paying work day. It is also a farewell to hustling for anything that is not the gift of music. This song is part of the "Queen George" chapter of my music that will include my recent releases.

lyrics.text:
You’re swimming in grey clouds and I’ve never been more black or white
I was never meant for the snow 
I see fire and I feel ice
You set the bar too high too high I might just lose my mind
Come on G get your coat we’re going out so I don’t cry 
I was Slipping a slipping away yeah slipping a slipping a 
Little more every day I’m losing you losing you
Swimming and drinking out late yeah maximum minimum 
But Minimum minimum wage don’t pay enough pay enough 
Pay it now

You’re playing with the dark clouds now
My angel where’d you go
Keep playing til the sky falls down
I’d never miss the show 

You were not supposed to know
But you’re ever where I go 
And I think I think a lot
And I think you miss too much 
And I don’t like
